programme.title: Living Universe
programme.desc: Project engineers revolutionize propulsion technology, navigation, and AI, then set their sights on the exoplanet Minerva B near Mars.

programme.title: Living Universe
programme.desc: Artemis arrives on the exoplanet Minerva B.

programme.title: Living Universe
programme.desc: Minerva B is a small rocky planet just like earth, where spacecraft Artemis has found water, organic molecules, and complex creatures.

programme.title: Hack the Moon: Unsung Heroes of Apollo
programme.sub-title: Hack the Moon: Unsung Heroes of Apollo
programme.desc: The story of the unsung engineers behind the technologies developed for the Apollo missions.

programme.title: Becoming Martian
programme.desc: The journey to the neighboring planet traces a path connecting Nikola Tesla, Nazi weapons of war, a Cold War space race, and a string of blockbuster discoveries made by some of NASA's most talented robots.

programme.title: Becoming Martian
programme.desc: Science may soon make the dream of traveling to Mars a reality.

programme.title: Becoming Martian
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Dr. Scott Solomon foresees a series of changes to our species from the size of our hearts and heads to the pigments in our skin.

programme.title: Living Universe
programme.desc: Humans have acquired the knowledge that every star in the sky is orbited by at least one planet, and over a quarter of those planets have the right conditions for life.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: Pavlov's investigations into dog digestion lead to phone addiction; a failed quest to find a safer refrigerant creates Teflon; a damaged delivery crate is instrumental in the invention of dynamite.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: The failed experiment and the world's greatest crime-fighting tool; a clumsily dressed cut leads to the invention of plastics; how chance conversation and sausage poison changed the face of Hollywood.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: Clumsy gesticulation throws a sample onto a stove, accidentally inventing vulcanized rubber; grabbing the wrong resistor leads to the pacemaker.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: Fumes from a broken thermometer cause the invention of photography; Radar parts and a melting snack bar lead to the microwave.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: A dirty laboratory and a vacation lead to the discovery of the first real weapon against bacteria: penicillin; a scientist's determination to test the wrong solution makes Kevlar.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: A Swiss chemist's attempt to make a lung drug results in LSD; the son of enslaved parents tries to reverse the fortunes of sharecroppers and inadvertently gives rise to PB&J.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Examining the history of the Great Wall of China.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Temples, designed to honor the Gods, have been at the heart of cities since earliest times; often they have been the biggest and most impressive buildings of their age.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Without water, civilization is simply not possible; Romans took control of their water supplies very, very seriously; in order to keep the taps on, Roman engineers constructed vast networks of aqueducts, tunnels, sewers, and drains.
